meanings.definition: To surpass in striding or stepping.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah was outstriding the other animals in the race.
meanings.sent2: She outstrided her previous record by a large margin.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident in his outstriding abilities.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was outstriding any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The champion runner's outstriding speed left the spectators in awe.

meanings.sent1: The explorer was outstriding into the unknown territory.
meanings.sent2: He outstrided the boundaries of his comfort zone to pursue his dreams.
meanings.sent3: The cat was outstriding around the garden, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was outstriding the limits of reality.
meanings.sent5: The kite was outstriding higher and higher in the sky, carried by the wind.
